page.title: 07Beach Survey
page.content: Sixtythree families were interviewed and we found most of them came from the East Midlands,but some came from as far away as Scotland.All except 2 were on holiday for at least a week, mainly staying in a holiday camp or caravans.The majority had been at least twice before saying that as they had come with children,they valued the amenities available for them,and the fact they obtained value for money. Most of them were on the beach because the children liked digging and building in the sand, or paddling and swimming in the sea.The adults found it good to relax and sun bathe.Forty two of the 63 families cooked their own meals but at times bought take away food or had meals out.The favourite evening pastimes seemed to be visiting a show or a public house after having enjoyed a walk by the sea
